text: have human on the search for some of the
most anticipated questions in the job
interview questions like tell me more
about yourself why are you leaving your
current job
what is your desired salary what are
your weaknesses tell me about a time
when you overcame a challenge if these
questions give you jitters and you're
afraid to answer them then don't worry I
have the perfect tips for you and the
perfect answers to these questions that
will give you a leg up in the
competition and an edge over other
candidates please watch my session on
this topic on skillopedia the place to
learn skills for the real world
the first question that you can expect
from the interviewer is why are you
leaving your current or previous job if
you already resigned and this question
makes most people trip because the
interview is trying to find out whether
you can work with them he's not trying
to find out if you can work for them
he's rather trying to find out whether
or not you can work with them you have
to be very careful about not ranting
about your previous employer that means
you shouldn't talk negative about your
previous employer the key to answering
this question is to maintain undying
positivity you must talk well about the
working environment because the employer
wants to find out whether or not you can
get along with people
and be sure not to talk about a low
salary because that will make your
employer feel that you're leaving purely
for money or that you're applying at the
new job purely for money so you must
mention how great your stay was at the
previous job however if you have some
genuine problem like the distance that
you had to travel you can be very honest
about it and answer this question
without any negativity so make sure
you're not negative and you answered
everything positively about your
previous employer
